availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Matthew Scott Dudley (Lexington, Kentucky, resident; pvt & adj 21st Ky Inf USA, ass't paymaster for KY 1865)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Ethelbert L. Dudley and Mary Dudley. Resident in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident in Lexington in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and adjutant from 1861 to 1863. Appointed assistant pay master for Kentucky by Governor Thomas E. Bramlette on April 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 144A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 2, p. 391.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 398..
